page.title: 13Peterborough Hospitals
page.content: { Peterborough District Hospital}is an acute complex of 850 beds. The main block was completed in 1968 and most acutely ill patients are treated here. There are six main operating theatres. The large outpatient and accident dep- artments are adjacent, together with most diagnostic and treatment depart- ments like X-ray, Pathology & Physio- therapy. The following units are on the West Site of the complex. Fenland House (1981) deals with geriatric patients. The Maternity Unit (1970) has beds for GP & Consultant patients and a Special Care Baby Unit. The Psychiatric department has beds in St. Johns (upgraded in 1983 for the elderly mentally ill), Conolly House (1975) and the Gables (both acute psychiatry), and a day unit at the Pines. There are also child and adol- escent psychiatric units.
